meanings.definition: Fluent or persuasive speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her eloquences captivated the audience during the speech.
meanings.sent2: The politician's eloquences swayed the voters in his favor.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's eloquences made even the most boring topic interesting.
meanings.sent4: His eloquences were like a soothing melody to the ears of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The eloquences of the poet painted vivid images in the minds of the readers.

meanings.definition: The art or power of using language with fluency and aptness.
meanings.sent1: The eloquences of the writer brought life to the characters in the story.
meanings.sent2: She admired the eloquences of the orator as he delivered his powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's eloquences had the audience bursting with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her eloquences were a beacon of light in the sea of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The eloquences of the chef's description made the dish irresistible.
